GeneralInformation.School Vision: Every Brooksian a Champion, Impacting the Community
GeneralInformation.School Mission: To empower Brooksians to develop a passion for learning, strong moral values and a keen sense of duty and community.
GeneralInformation.School Philosophy, Culture and Ethos: Northbrooks' name in Chinese is derived from the meaningful Chinese proverb 'yin shui si yuan' to always remember our roots and be grateful to our family, teachers, friends and country for the success we achieve in life. The school motto: VOLATILIS TAMEN RADICALIS (SOARING YET ROOTED) challenges our students to SOAR to greater heights whilst staying ROOTED in strong values; motivated to excel, to lead, and to serve.  The school values acronym, "G.I.F.T.E.D.", is formed by the six values: Graciousness, Integrity, Fortitude, Teamwork, Empathy and Discipline. The school is committed to providing engaging learning experiences that allow them to practise the G.I.F.T.E.D. values. In the belief that students must put their values and citizenship education into action, the school partners various community organisations to offer Service-Learning opportunities for our students to contribute to the community.
GeneralInformation.Type of School: GOVERNMENT SCHOOL / CO-ED SCHOOL / SINGLE SESSION

School Distinctive Programmes.STEM: Northbrooks Aerospace Programme (Applied Learning In Aerospace)
School Distinctive Programmes.Sports & Outdoor Education: Northbrooks Outdoor Education: Adventure, Character, Environment (A.C.E.) Programme

SpecialProgrammes.Special Student Development Programmes O: The school's distinctive Applied Learning Programme (ALP) in Aerospace opens a pathway for our students to make a career choice in the rapidly growing aerospace industry by giving them an edge when applying for aerospace-related courses in ITE and the Polytechnics. All Lower Secondary students are equipped with basic knowledge in general aerospace topics and requisite ICT skills. Students found to be passionate in this area would be sent to participate in external related competitions and programmes. Our Learning for Life Programme (LLP) in Outdoor Education (Adventure, Character, Environment) aims to inculcate values, develop character and build leadership skills of all students through a three-tiered programme using nature and the outdoors. Through programmes such as orienteering, rockwall climbing and Values-In-Action (VIA) activities, we hope to cultivate in students a love for the outdoors and a heart for the environment they live in. Annual camps that emphasise experiential learning, values education and self-leadership are held concurrently for each level. A variety of enrichment programmes are also provided by the school to widen the exposure of students in the cognitive, physical and aesthetics domains. For example, the Stained Glass Art Programme is used as a tool to express creativity and to develop the spirit of Innovation and Enterprise. As the making of stained glass artwork requires intricate skill and patience, students working in teams develop fortitude, resilience and learn to value each other's strengths. The Whole School Approach to Effective Communication (WSA-EC) aims to build students' competencies in communicating in English and incorporates learning activities in various subject disciplines, all designed to raise students' interest and motivation in reading and speaking good English.
